structure.unit: STATE UNIVERSITIES AND COLLEGES -- REGIONAL EDUCATION -- ARCHAEOLOGY

law.catch_line: Rules and regulations governing loans, loan guarantees, scholarships, grants, and work-study programs.

text.section:
In the instance of loans, the rules and regulations adopted by the board may include, but not be limited to, those which:
Are necessary to qualify the authority as an insured lender under the Higher Education Act of 1965, as amended;
Require that loans be made only to those eligible students who are unable to secure comparable loans from private lenders; and
Are necessary to qualify the authority as a lender under the Public Health Service Act, as amended.

In the instance of insured student loans and loan guarantees, the rules and regulations adopted by the board shall include, but not be limited to, those which are necessary to qualify the authority to insure loans under the federal act, as amended, and following such qualification to issue loan guarantees to participating lenders on any loans advanced by such lenders to eligible students attending or planning to attend any participating institution.
Funds appropriated to the financial assistance program established by KRS 164.780 and 164.785 shall be administered by the board in accordance with the provisions of KRS 164.780 and 164.785.

In the instance of work-study payments, rules and regulations adopted by the board shall include, but not be limited to, those which require that:
The employment opportunity available for the student will not interfere with the student's normal progress toward a degree, diploma, or certificate;
Contracts to promote increased employment opportunities for eligible students will not result in the displacement of employed workers or impair existing contracts for services; and
The work-study payment will not exceed the financial need of the student or the maximum payment as established by the board, whichever is less.
